H0.text: What word, from Latin meaning 'I shall please' refers to a control substance used in drug trials which has no chemical effect. Placebo

H1.text: What word, from Latin meaning 'I shall please' refers to a control substance used in drug trials which has no chemical effect. Placere

H2.text: What word, from Latin meaning 'I shall please' refers to a control substance used in drug trials which has no chemical effect. Plebium

H3.text: What word, from Latin meaning 'I shall please' refers to a control substance used in drug trials which has no chemical effect. Cebocap

A4.text: The Latin term placebo means [I] shall be pleasing.

A5.text: A placebo can be roughly defined as a sham medical treatment.
